Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the interior is ribbed and bears traces of two lines of black-painted demotic text, the exterior is covered with a rough cream-coloured slip and faint traces of at least three lines of black-painted demotic text. Join to EA 66233.
Curator's comments: Joins EA 66233. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Frankfort 1933 / The Cenotaph of Seti I at Abydos (no.20, p.96)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51803) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/51803)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.9)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 9 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
